did.abstract: Informational flyers, brochures, newsletters, and books acquired by the Montana Human Rights Network from a departing member of the Church of the Creator Northwest headquartered in Montana.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Church of the Creator (COTC) was a white supremacist group founded in 1973 by Ben Klassen. Following Klassen’s suicide in 1993 the group was led by Matt Hale.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains published books and a small amount of ephemera written by Ben Klassen, founder of the Church of the Creator. Also included are two contextual documents by the Montana Human Rights Network.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes.

prefercite.p: Ben Klassen Publications and Ephemera, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: The contents in this collection were in a storage unit belonging to a member of the Church of the Creator Northwest, a splinter group of Matt Hale's World Church of the Creator, prior to being acquired by the Montana Human Rights Network in 2003.

acqinfo.p: The content in this collection was mailed to the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library by the Montana Human Rights Network.

relatedmaterial.p: The Mansfield Library's Archives and Special Collections also holds a Right Wing Radicalism collection of publications (PAM 09).

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
